title: Akamai DataStream 2 Overview
description:
This Dashboard provides a high level overview of your Akamai DataStream 2 performance and security logs for your delivery properties. 

View detailed analytics on client information, traffic, caching, latency, and more.

For further reading, see the [Akamai Datastream 2 Integration Docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/akamai_datastream_2/)

Clone this template dashboard to make changes and add your own graph widgets.

definition.content:
[DataStream 2](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/docs) captures performance and security logs from your delivery properties and streams them in near real-time to provide complete monitoring. 

Clone this template dashboard to make changes and add your own graph widgets.
Cache hits are incoming requests that are served from cache at the edge. Content served from cache by parent servers is not reported by DataStream by default and will be reported as a cache miss.
Cache hits and misses usually have very different latencies due to the extra time required to get content from origin. Modifications to caching rules can reduce latency and improve user experience.

Bandwidth usage should generally be steady, and correlate with request rate. CDN cost is generally a function of bandwidth. 
Sudden spikes in bandwidth could either be good (organic traffic increase) or bad (malicious actors trying to increase your system load with a high number of requests).

When you Create a stream or Edit a stream, you can choose to log midgress traffic within the Akamai network, such as between two edge servers. This feature also requires enabling the Collect midgress traffic option in the DataStream behavior for your property in Property Manager.

For more information visit [Data set parameters documentation](https://techdocs.akamai.com/datastream2/docs/data-set-parameters)

Client errors (4xx responses) often represent security events—such as blocked requests, bot detections, or access control enforcement. Tracking trends in 4xx responses helps surface malicious behavior, misconfigured rules, or unexpected traffic patterns. Monitoring these over time can help fine-tune protections without degrading legitimate user access.

search.query: source:akamai.datastream (@network.client.geoip.as.name:(*bot* OR *crawler* OR *spider* OR *scraper*) OR @akamai.datastream.statusCode:[400 TO 499])
